result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert G. Crust was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine $379.00   Pay obligation within 60 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 60 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.
DNA surcharge $200.00   Pay obligation within 60 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 60 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.
10 days in Sawyer County jail with huber and good time.  To begin on/before 2/29/16 at 3:00 pm

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert G. Crust in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant entered plea of no contest.  Court finds defendant guilty. VIS tendered.

Court:  10 days county jail to begin on/before 2/29/16 at 3:00 pm with huber and good time
            Fine: $379.00 / DNA Surcharge $200.00 total $579.00 given 60 dtp

OFF the RECOrd:  Defendant Robert G. Crust in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Duffy is requesting a continuation.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Robert G. Crust in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  9:59 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Duffy requests another status.  Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant Robert G. Crust in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.
No Contact with Arielle Crust and Steve Longtine.   Arrangments to be in place by 3rd party for child exchange.
No Contact with Arielle Crust and Steve Longtine.   Arrangments to be in place by 3rd party for child exchange.

Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.
